e4: Changing to the new policy ensures accurate, unbiased financial reporting, fostering greater trust and integrity with investors. It decreases potential legal risks associated with biased reporting and aligns with ethical business practices. Although some investors may initially misinterpret the change, clear communication can clarify the policy shift.
e5: An ethical reporting policy ensures accuracy, transparency, and honesty, reflecting true financial performance without bias. It should consider all stakeholders, minimize legal risks, and demonstrate accountability. Ethical policies align with regulatory standards and anticipate potential misunderstandings, using clear communication to prevent misinformation and protect all investor types fairly.
e6: How does management plan to communicate the policy change to ensure all investors understand the absence of previous bias? Are there strategies in place to help retail investors who might misinterpret the new reports, and how will feedback from the investment community be gathered post-change?
